## 사건 정보

**사건명**: Stanley T. ADAMS v. Margaret BRADSHAW, Warden
**판결일**: 2016-03-15
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Cole, Siler, White

## 변호인

ARGUED: Neil S. McElroy, Toledo, OH, for Appellant. Charles L. Wille, Office of the Ohio Attorney General, Columbus, OH, for Appellee. ON BRIEF: Neil S. McElroy, Jeffrey J. Heimiek, Toledo, OH, Spiros P. Cocoves, Toledo, OH, for Appellant. Thomas E. Madden, Jocelyn S. Kelly, Office of the Ohio Attorney General, Columbus, OH, for Appellee.

## 인용

- 817 F.3d 284

## 판결문 요약


OPINION
SILER, Circuit Judge.
Stanley T. Adams, an Ohio death row inmate, appeals the district court’s order denying his petition for a writ of habeas *287corpus .filed under 28 -U.S.C. § 2254. We certified two claims for appellate review: (1) whether requiring Adams to wear a stun belt throughout trial denied him a fundamentally fair trial; and (2) whether Ohio’s lethal injection protocol violated the Eighth Amendment. We granted Adams’s motion to hold the case in abeyance pending the resolution of Glossip v. Gross, — U.S. -, 135 S.Ct. 2726, 192 L.Ed.2d 761 (2015), which was decided on June 29, 2015. For the following reasons, we AFFIRM the district court’s denial of a writ of habeas corpus.
FACTUAL BACKGROUND
I. State court proceedings
An Ohio jury convicted Adams of burglary, kidnapping, two counts of rape, and three counts of aggravated murder. Following the penalty phase, the trial court followed the jury’s recommendation and sentenced Adams to death. On direct appeal, the Supreme Court of Ohio vacated Adams’s kidnapping conviction and the related specifications, but affirmed the remaining convictions and the death sentence. State v. Adams, 103 Ohio St.3d 508, 817 N.E.2d 29, 59 (2004).
